sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1:
Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. The Cartesian product of A and B is (1,2), (1,3), (1,4), (2,2), (2,3), (2,4), (3,2), (3,3), and (3,4). 

Determine the symmetric difference of A and B with respect to their Cartesian product. Show that it is not commutative by proving that (A△B) × C ≠ A × C △ B × C for set C = {1, 2, 3}.
